overview: This Act shall be known and may be cited as the Judiciary Appropriations Act of 2025. [1] It appropriates funds for the Judiciary for the fiscal biennium beginning 7/1/2025, and ending 6/30/2027. [1] The total expenditures and the number of permanent and temporary positions established in each fiscal year of the fiscal biennium shall not exceed the sums and the position ceilings indicated for each year, except as provided in this Act. [1]
appropriations: The legislative document appropriates various sums for operating costs to the judiciary for the fiscal biennium beginning July 1, 2025, and ending June 30, 2027. [1] For example, the legislative document specifies operating funds for JUD101 - Courts of Appeal as $9,592,659 (HB400_.HTM.txt) for FY 2026 and $9,657,093 (HB400_.HTM.txt) for FY 2027. [1] The legislative document also appropriates a sum of $9,900,000 (HB400_.HTM.txt) from general obligation bond funds for capital improvement projects. [1] [1]
assumptions_and_methodology: The legislative document specifies that sums are appropriated or authorized to accomplish the purposes and programs designated. [1] The total expenditures and the number of permanent and temporary positions shall not exceed the sums and the position ceilings indicated for each year. [1] For capital improvement projects, the amount after each cost element and the total funding for each project are listed in thousands of dollars. [1]
agency_impact: The chief justice is authorized to transfer sufficient funds and positions between programs for operating purposes whenever the need arises. [1] The judiciary may delegate the planning, acquisition of land, design, construction, and equipment of any capital improvement project to other state or county agencies if it is determined to be advantageous. [1] If funds for a capital project are insufficient, the chief justice may make supplemental allotments from the judiciary project adjustment fund. [1]
economic_impact: This bill appropriates funds for the Judiciary for the fiscal biennium beginning 7/1/2025, and ending 6/30/2027. [1] The legislative document specifies a sum of $9,900,000 (HB400_.HTM.txt) for capital improvement projects to be expended by the judiciary. [1] These projects include plans, design, construction, and equipment for general alterations, upgrades, and improvements to judiciary facilities statewide. [1]
policy_impact: This Act shall be known and may be cited as the Judiciary Appropriations Act of 2025. [1] It provides that appropriations for capital improvement projects shall not lapse at the end of the fiscal year, but any funds unencumbered as of June 30, 2028, shall lapse as of that date. [1] All unrequired balances in the general obligation bond fund, after the objectives for capital improvements have been met, shall be transferred to the judiciary project adjustment fund. [1]
revenue_sources: The means of financing are specified by letter symbols, which include A for General funds, B for Special funds, C for General obligation bond funds, and W for Revolving funds. [1] Capital improvement projects are funded by $9,900,000 (HB400_.HTM.txt) from General obligation bond funds (C). [1] The chief justice may also secure federal funds or funds from private organizations or individuals for programs authorized by this Act. [1]
six_year_fiscal_implications: The bill appropriates funds for the fiscal biennium beginning July 1, 2025, and ending June 30, 2027. [1] For FY 2025-2026, operating appropriations from general funds include $9,592,659 (HB400_.HTM.txt) for JUD101 - Courts of Appeal and $98,130,866 (HB400_.HTM.txt) for JUD310 – First Circuit. [1] For FY 2026-2027, the appropriations for these programs are $9,657,093 (HB400_.HTM.txt) and $98,298,808 (HB400_.HTM.txt) respectively. [1] [1] The legislative document also appropriates $9,900,000 (HB400_.HTM.txt) in investment capital from general obligation bond funds for FY 2025-2026. [1] This funding is designated for projects including $4,000,000 (HB400_.HTM.txt) for the new South Kohala Judiciary Complex, $900,000 (HB400_.HTM.txt) for the Pu‘uhonua Kaulike A/C Systems Replacement, and $5,000,000 (HB400_.HTM.txt) for lump sum CIP for Judiciary Facilities, Statewide. [1] [1] [1] General obligation bonds may be issued to finance these projects, provided the sum total does not exceed $9,900,000 (HB400_.HTM.txt). operating_revenue_impact: The document appropriates funds from general funds, special funds, and revolving funds for operations. [1] The chief justice may secure federal funds or funds from private organizations or individuals for authorized programs. [1] Additionally, the judiciary may transfer savings from its general fund appropriation to the driver education and training fund to accommodate any temporary cash flow deficits. [1]
capital_expenditure_impact: The legislative document specifies the sum of $9,900,000 (HB400_.HTM.txt) is appropriated for capital improvement projects for the judiciary. [1] Projects listed include $4,000,000 (HB400_.HTM.txt) for plans and design for a new judiciary complex in South Kohala, $900,000 (HB400_.HTM.txt) for A/C systems replacement in Kaua`i, and $5,000,000 (HB400_.HTM.txt) for lump sum CIP for judiciary facilities statewide. fiscal_implications_after_6_years: The appropriations in the bill are for the fiscal biennium ending June 30, 2027. [1] All appropriations made for capital improvement projects that are unencumbered as of June 30, 2028, shall lapse as of that date.
